title: Bug: Form View with Attachment and Links Field, entry triggers "Failed to load list"
description: Please confirm that the bug report does not already exist - [x] I confirm there is no existing issue for this bug.  Steps to reproduce 1. Create a Form View which has both an Attachment and a Links (many-to-many) field (and some example data, of course) 2. Fill in the attachment field *first* (i.e. by picking a file from the local machine, upload it) 3. Attempt to fill in the Links field (click the plus button next to "No records linked", expect an autocomplete-ish drop down) 4. Error message: "Failed to load list: something went wrong"; there is no list of records to select from ("No records match your search query"); inputs into the search field re-trigger the error above  Desired Behavior No error :), Link should be selectable (without the workaround to select it first, *then* picking a file)  Project Details Node: **v22.14.0** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.262.0**  Attachments Analysis: The Link field attempts to populate possible record values by requesting/fetching the endpoint `/api/v1/db/public/shared-view/$UUID/nested/$BASE36ISHSTRING`. It **GET**s a query which roughly decodes to: `{ limit: 10, offset: 0, fields: []`, but also, `rowData: { TheAttachmentField: [ {,"title":"TheFilename.jpg","data":"base64,/TheFullFileEncodedInBase64AAAAA`,. The size of the GET request (I think) makes it fail; even for quite small files. Chrom* reports this as `net::ERR_CONNECTION_CLOSED` in the console, Firefox is rather silent on my machine. The file (contents) shouldn't be appended to the query in the first place, I guess. As far as I can tell, this happens ultimately here: https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/blob/0cadb29e18e7f503bace209275e7148716eccd35/packages/nc-gui/composables/useLTARStore.ts#L213 ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9020300a-47b1-420c-8ad4-3cdf09a50b40) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a5595154-de08-4e85-aff9-5c4087550a92)

title: Bug: Filtering by checkbox columns is inconsistent
description: Now, checkboxes can be filtered in UI by using 'is equal' and 'is not equal' with 'false' and 'true' strings. In REST API [docs](https://docs.nocodb.com/developer-resources/rest-apis/#comparison-operators), 'is' and 'isnot' comparison operators exist for boolean values, - but only 'isnot, null' query works. However, query results can be filtered by checkboxes with 'eq' operator. Weird enough, 'not' operator has no effect on 'true' and 'false' strings. I think, solution should be: * Add new comparison options in filter UI to be used with checkboxes, which have to treat 'null' values as false ones. * Fix 'is' and 'isnot' to work as declared in docs. title: Bug: Plus Email Address Not Accepted
description: Version: 0.9.15 Docker When attempting to create a new user that has a "+" in the Email address, an "E-mail must be valid" error is returned. Plus addressing is valid per [RFC 2822](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2822#section-3.4.1) and is supported by major Email providers such as Gmail and Office 365/Exchange to name a few. **Steps to Replicate** - Open a Project - Click "Team & Auth" - Click "New User" - Attempt to create a user with a "+" in the address, such as "validation+bug@nocodb.com" - Observe the "E-mail must be valid" message **What is Expected?** The Email is valid per RFC spec and should be allowed.

title: [Bug] Condition for webhook automation does not take boolean type into consideration
description: NocoDB used as docker : **false** NocoDB version : **"nocodb": "^0.84.6"** Database used in NC_DB URL : **pg** Project was created by clicking : **New Project by connecting to external database** Database on which spreadsheet is created : **pg** OS on which NocoDB is running : **Ubuntu 18.04.6 LTS** Node.js version if running as node : **v15.3.0** Database version : **Postgres 12.9** **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Install Slack App 1. Create webhook automation for Slack app that happens after an update 1. Add a condition for when the update happens 1. Condition needs to be related to a column like a checkbox or another column that implements a boolean type (TRUE/FALSE) 1. Example condition would be: `where, column_name, is equal, true` **Notes** 1. An example JSON that is sent back to the BE is: "[{\"field\":\"Validated\",\"op\":\"is equal\",\"value\":\"true\",\"logicOp\":\"and\"}]"). 1. Even after the values are parsed, with JSON.parse, the value remains a string:  [ { "field": "Validated", "op": "is equal", "value": "true", "logicOp": "and" } ]  1. The check I believe happens here: https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/blob/1cbaaab6bf838aa8c38a35f3fab06670ca8d9264/packages/nocodb/src/lib/noco/common/BaseModel.ts#L397. `data[field]` is probably `TRUE` while `con.value` is `"true"`. These would never equate unless the value itself is parsed further to see if it can be converted into a boolean value. The suggested change would probably be to just do: `JSON.parse(con.value)`. **Expected behavior** When the condition is met, such as when a column is true and the condition put in is `"true"`, then the webhook should be sent out afterward. I believe this is not happening because the values are not parsed from the JS side, I believe they are all literal strings instead of appropriate values.

title: DATEADD formula issues
description: Using DATEADD formula (`IF(NOW() < DATEADD(test_date_time,10,'day'), "true", "false")` like in [docs](https://docs.nocodb.com/setup-and-usages/formulas#date-functions)) results in empty table. There is error console with code 400 in response to GET database entries request. Response body has message noting that there is no $1 operator: `timestamp with time zone < text`. To test, I've tried basic image ( `docker run -d --name nocodb -p 8080:8080 nocodb/nocodb:latest`) and there DATEADD works, though date subtraction fails, as it planned in #1415 . Providing negative number in formula results in 400 error with msg "Cannot read property 'argument' of undefined".
